intro: Aeschynomene spinulosa, commonly known as the hairy Aeschynomene, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid conditions, making it a hardy and adaptable species. Aeschynomene spinulosa is also used in some traditional medicinal practices and as a forage crop for livestock.
